meanings.definition: One of two bands of frequencies that are produced by the modulation of a carrier wave.
meanings.sent1: The sidebands of the radio signal carry additional information.
meanings.sent2: The sidebands of the music signal enhance the audio quality.
meanings.sent3: The sidebands of the transmission decided to throw a party.
meanings.sent4: The sidebands of the sound wave whispered secrets to each other.
meanings.sent5: The sidebands of the wave danced in harmony with the carrier wave.

meanings.definition: The frequency range of a signal that extends beyond the main carrier frequency.
meanings.sent1: The sidebands of the TV signal can sometimes cause interference.
meanings.sent2: The sidebands of the radar signal help detect objects at a distance.
meanings.sent3: The sidebands of the music signal started a band of their own.
meanings.sent4: The sidebands of the light wave painted colorful patterns in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The sidebands of the signal sang a melody that resonated far and wide.
